# BCACTFⅠ - Writeup


I participated as a team at BCACTF held from June 9th to June 16th.
I don't usually understand Crypte, but since I solved one question, I will post it as Writeup.

### three-step-program

````
We found this strange file with a bunch of stuff in it... Can you help us decode it?
made by: @mars7543
````

There is an attached file in addition to the above, and the following message is described.

````
MzIgLSAgfDMgVGltZXMgQSBDaGFybXwgLSAzMg==



lhlm oad lamaew eyhmgs. lg i sxsro rgu ntee qhj a qesg? dbfcp rgu stne xtve tm lhtl xac, b’dl rh wadr gn jhm ayw zayw at zowr.
mvscey{bu57_j0n_o4i7_kgbhmffhlqe} bfm, te htjnpw, feim lixx at hhf’t mx ko dbepwx…
````

* Since there is = in the first section, decode with base64.

````
root@kali:~# echo "MzIgLSAgfDMgVGltZXMgQSBDaGFybXwgLSAzMg==" | base64 -d
32 -  |3 Times A Charm| - 32r
````

* The second verse is decoded with base32 from the composition of numbers + uppercase letters.

````
s=""
>>>
>>> s1=base64.b32decode(s)
>>> print(s1)

````


The following character string is displayed at the third time, and SALT is identified as a keyword from the characters “1. SALT iz key to gret food!”.

Why english so ard to tok.
No speak more English.
Ail gi you tu hints to read my encrypted languich.

1. SALT iz key to gret food!
2. Le francais crypte le meilleur


* The third verse is solved using SALT as a keyword.
After examining various things, it turns out that it is Vigenere encryption. When checking with online solver, flag can be confirmed.

````
that was simple enough. so i heard you came for a flag? since you have made it this far, i’ll go easy on you and hand it over.
bcactf{ju57_y0u_w4i7_znjhbmnhaxm} but, be warned, next time it won’t be so simple…
````

###### bcactf{ju57_y0u_w4i7_znjhbmnhaxm}
